01

Recap 2015

Afterhours is a poster party off the clock. It's part individual creative expression, part curated poster show, and part non-profit fundraiser.

This whole idea started with a small group of designers came togeather in 2015 to create this show. None of us really knew what would happen but holy cow it was epic. We had over 80+ artist submit for our initial show but sadly had to choose just 30 -- luckily our judges helped with that (Thank you, Lauren, Brad, Armin & Geoff) The 30 artist selected created some pretty rad posters.

The shows goal was to have some kind of impact in the Austin community by partnering with a non-profit partner. Our 2015 partner was Capital Area Food Bank of Texas (now the Central Texas Food Bank), and through poster sales and donations were able to raise over 200 lbs of food donations, and over $3,200.00 and to top it off we sold over 280 posters!

Watch the video from last years show

Let’s do it again!

November 12-13, 2015
Lewis Carnegie

Last year was such a success, we are gonna do it again! So please mark your calendars and join us during the East Austin Studio tour back at LewisCarnegie!

Interested in being involved with Afterhours through sponsorship or volunteering this year?

Lets chat

03

Call for Entries

Submit by Sept. 5 2016, 11:59pm

Last year we received 80+ submissions for the show trying to fill just 30 spots. Due to the great turn out of the event last year and the demand we got via submissions we decided to increase the number of artist in the show to 40.

The submission is uber easy, just submit a bit of information about yourself and three previous pieces of work (do not create new work, it’s not necessary) that shows your style via the link below.

Submit Here
